Description: In this role, you will have the opportunity to learn a wide range of core Ethernet Technologies with architectural exposure to design and develop Ethernet Switching as applied to both Public and Private cloud infrastructure. You will work on the intricacies of the mission-critical infrastructure that enables the world-class, multi-layered Nexus switches. In addition, you will have the opportunity to participate in cross-functional teamwork and be exposed to all facets of the software development cycle from innovation, marketing requirement to product delivery.Participate on a project team of engineers involved in the development of software for the Nexus Series switch product family, with emphasis in L2, L3, VXLAN and MPLS areasDefine, architect, design, and deliver new features for the Nexus Series platforms.Maintain existing features and champion innovative ways to constantly improve the software.Influence the design of interfaces between products to ensure inter-operability.Develop large portions of software independently and rapidly.Strong C programming skills.Knowledge of Linux OS InternalsFamiliarity with Ethernet Switching Silicon (Merchant or Custom Silicon)Strong problem solving and software development/trouble shooting skillsHands on experience on switch/router embedded system software development.Typically requires MSEE/CS combined with 8+ years of related experience, or BSEE/CS combined with 10+ yrs of related experienceWhy Cisco?#WeAreCisco.
